name: Animate Dead Rune
notes:
Notes
Use it on a corpse to transform it into a skeleton to become your minion like a summoned monster.
It may be convenient for paladins and knights to have such a summon in certain situations: for instance to block monsters that doesn't push other.
If in need, you may bring a corpse with yourself. For instance, a Dead Snake weights 12 oz and is usable for 11 minutes.
There are certain rules governing when the rune may be used:

You must stand next to a corpse (it cannot be in your backpack) and the tile (or an adjacent one) must be free for the summon to spawn. It's possible to summon a skeleton while the character and the corpse are both inside a Protection Zone.
You cannot use the rune on non-decaying corpses or special corpse-alike objects like the Dead Frog (Item) dropped by Dark Apprentices. However, at the time of writing, Lizard Snakecharmers still drop a regular snake corpse.
It cannot be used on a first stage of corpse decay of certain creatures: humans, but they decay quickly.
You cannot use it during the first 10 seconds after killing a monster, as the rune will destroy a corpse like a Disintegrate Rune.
For the spell, see Animate Dead.

name: Avalanche Rune
notes:
Notes
 Shoots an Ice attack that covers a large circular area centered around the target, this is the Druids' equivalent of the Great Fireball.
The spell to create the rune is called Avalanche.

name: Chameleon Rune
notes:
Notes
Turns you into an item. The effect lasts for 200 seconds (3 minutes, 20 seconds).Using this rune on an item will turn you into it.
Often used for fun. But on PvP worlds this can be used to hide from PKs, just turn yourself into a useless item and go upstairs to cover your name. You cannot use it on a creature, an NPC, another player or immovable objects.
For the spell, see Chameleon.

name: Convince Creature Rune
notes:
Notes
Convinces a creatures to help you.Convince Creature and Paralyze are the only runes that need mana to be used.The mana required to use this rune varies depending upon the creature that you want to convince.There are some creatures that cannot be convinced and some creatures that can only be convinced (cannot be summoned). You also cannot convince monster summoned by someone else.
For the spell, see Convince Creature.

name: Cure Poison Rune (Item)
notes:
Notes
Cures the target from Poison.This rune is not used much after level 10 as any vocation can use the Cure Poison spell instead.
This could be useful to have one to heal you when you get poisoned and you don't have Mana for the Cure Poison spell.
Once were able to buy this rune in Rookgaard from Lily. But since the update they have removed the item instead a player can buy an Antidote Potion from her.
Some characters still have the rune in Rookgaard making it a collectors item.
For the spell, see Cure Poison Rune.

name: Destroy Field Rune
notes:
Notes
Destroys fire, poison and energy fields, from any distance as long there's nothing blocking the path.This rune is useful to escape from PK traps in PvP worlds and is needed in a couple of quests. Previously it could be used to loot monsters that may be under the fields layed by other monsters until the introduction of the Quick Looting mechanic, rendering this rune's usage still possible but obsolete.
For the spell, see Destroy Field.

name: Disintegrate Rune
notes:
Notes
Destroys movable objects.Very useful, try to have some in your backpack if you are in a PvP world because it may help save you from a PK trap. You need to stand next to the item(s) you want to disintegrate. It will disintegrate up to 500 movable items (it will not disintegrate any dead human body, but it will disintegrate monster bodies). It does not count as an aggressive action, and therefore works in Protection Zones and does not prevent the player from entering them.

name: Energy Bomb Rune
notes:
Notes
 Creates a 3x3 area of Energy Fields.It is an Upgrade of Energy Field. There are some old energy bombs in Antica with a larger area and 15 charges. The energy fields will last for 1:38.
Before some major updates you used to be able to trap monsters in bombs and they would not walk out (Ex: GS trapped in Firebomb)
For the spell, see Energy Bomb.

name: Energy Field Rune
notes:
Notes
 Creates an energy field, initial damage of 30 and followed by 25 addtional damage once the field is left.This rune may be useful to block certain monsters. The energy field will last for 1 minute 38 seconds.
For the spell, see Energy Field.

name: Energy Wall Rune
notes:
Notes
 Creates a 1x7 Energy Fields Area if shot straight from the body. If shot on an angle, a total of 13 energy field squares will be made spanning 7 sqm vertical and 7 sqm horizontal.Similar to Poison Wall Rune and Fire Wall Rune but is wider and deals Energy damage. On the other hand, it lasts shorter than other wall runes. The energy fields will last for 1 min. 38 sec.
For the spell, see Energy Wall.

name: Explosion Rune
notes:
Notes
 If you want to maximize your damage, you have to aim well with this Rune due to its small area of effect.
Explosion is the only Rune which inflicts Physical Damage.
Area of effect (the centre is the square which is targeted):

name: Fire Bomb Rune
notes:
Notes
 Creates a 3x3 square of Fire Fields.This spell is an upgrade of Fire Field. On Open PvP worlds, this spell is useful for trapping players during battle, though it allows for low-level characters to suicide and give unjusts to unsuspecting combatants.  The first stage of the fire field lasts 3:20; the second stage lasts for 2:28; the last stage (that does not block a monster) lasts 1:38.  Total time that a fire field will block a monster is 5:48. One of the best ways to trap and kill afk botters is to shoot the firebomb directly at them, then they can't move for almost 6 minutes. Also good if you are a lower level than the botter and to test if he has attack player on.
Before some major updates you used to be able to trap monsters in bombs and they would not walk out (Ex: GS trapped in Firebomb)
For the spell, see Fire Bomb.

name: Fire Field Rune
notes:
Notes
 Creates a Fire Field.This rune is frequently used in PvP worlds by PKers to trap people and sometimes on Optional PvP worlds to Scam people.
Every time you step on a fire field you will receive 20 fire damage. You will then be burning and receive 10 fire damage over 7 turns, each 9 seconds. For a total of 90 health lost in 1 minute.
This field spell is useful as a secondary attack rune that helps speed up killing players and monsters. This fire field also provides more light if compared to the other field spells. Quite useful as this field rune provides the most damage for a single hit but it takes long for all the damage to kick in, if you want fast damage use Energy Field.
The first stage of the fire field lasts 3:20; the second stage lasts for 2:28; the last stage (that does not block a monster) lasts 1:38.  Total time that a fire field will block a monster is 5:48.
For the spell, see Fire Field.

name: Fire Wall Rune
notes:
Notes
 Creates a 1x5 Fire Fields area if shot straight from the body.  If shot on an angle, a total of 9 fire field squares will be made spanning 5 sqm vertical and 5 sqm horizontal.The first stage of the fire field lasts 3:20; the second stage lasts for 2:28; the last stage (that does not block a monster) lasts 1:38.  Total time that a fire field will block a monster is 5:48.
For the spell, see Fire Wall.

name: Fireball Rune
notes:
Notes
 Shoots a Fire Attack, this is the Sorcerers' equivalent of the Icicle.
For the spell, see Fireball.

name: Great Fireball Rune
notes:
Notes
 Shoots a large circular flame attack based on the center of the selected area, this is the Sorcerers' equivalent of the Avalanche.This rune is really useful to get rid of big groups of monsters when the character gets surrounded or when you need to clear a room. It once was available to make at level 23, however this was changed in an update.
For the spell, see Great Fireball.

name: Healing Rune for Druids
notes:
Notes
This rune was implemented in the Winter Update 2012 when Isle of Destiny was revamped, suggesting that it was intended to be given during the Festival of Initiates. Although the item name implies this rune can only be used by druids, there is no actual vocation requirement to use it. It is believed to be an Unobtainable Item.

name: Heavy Magic Missile Rune
notes:
Notes
 Shoots an attack that inflicts Energy Damage.This rune is mostly used by Paladins and Mages.
For the spell, see Heavy Magic Missile.

name: Holy Missile Rune
notes:
Notes
 Shoots an attack that inflicts Holy Damage.This rune can only be created and used by paladins.It deals a little bit more damage than Divine Missile and has more range.Due to the very low cost merchants sell them at, it would be better for paladins to buy them instead of creating them.
This rune was added to the game in the Christmas Update 2008.
For the spell, see Holy Missile.

name: Icicle Rune
notes:
Notes
 Shoots an Ice attack, this is the Druids' equivalent of the Fireball.Very useful for mages to hunt creatures that are weak against ice damage, such as Dragons, Dragon Lords and Demons, since it has a longer range than Ice Strike and does about 33% more damage.
For the spell, see Icicle.

name: Intense Healing Rune (Item)
notes:
Notes
Heals target better than Light Healing.This rune is not commonly used. This rune should not be used often, if at all, by knights due to their low magic level affecting the potency of the rune and the higher healing potential of the Health Potion. However, this rune is useful to use on summoned or convinced creatures, due to its ease of creation and higher healing potency of the vocations that summon or convince. It costs 4000 Soul Points per Backpack.
For the spell, see Intense Healing Rune.

name: Light Magic Missile Rune
notes:
Notes
 Shoots a weak attack that causes Energy Damage.The weakest attack spell. It does about half of the damage of a Heavy Magic Missile shot. It is not useful for hunting, but useful to finish monsters with low HP when you don't want to waste a Heavy Magic Missile.
For the spell, see Light Magic Missile.
Looks the same as a Lightest Magic Missile Rune.

    Shot of Lmm on a Monk

name: Light Stone Shower Rune
notes:
Notes
 Shoots an earth attack that covers a small circular area around the target. The character using this rune is never affected by it. This is the only area attack rune available in Dawnport.

name: Lightest Magic Missile Rune
notes:
Notes
 Shoots a weak attack that causes Energy Damage, weaker than the Light Magic Missile Rune, causing ~5 damage. You can make 10 of these runes with the Practise Magic Missile spell. You can get 10 of these runes from Salbra during the Festival of Initiates.
It looks the same as a Light Magic Missile Rune.

name: Lightest Missile Rune
notes:
Notes
This object has no notes.

name: Magic Wall Rune
notes:
Notes
 Creates a magic wall which lasts for 16 to 24 seconds and blocks one square meter. The wall will block all types of ammunition, spells and runes thrown or cast by both players and creatures.  
Used heavily in PvP to trap enemies as well as to prevent projectiles from being fired at a given character. On Optional PvP worlds, it's used to block the attack from creatures but also to prevent them from walking over a certain tile and thus creating barricades or safe passages through them, since on these worlds they can be destroyed by walking over them. 
For the spell, see Magic Wall.

name: Paralyse Rune
notes:
Notes
Paralyses target. Any healing spell on the paralyzed target will cancel the effect.This is a very expensive rune, which can only be created and used by druids. It costs 1400 mana to make, and an additional 1400 mana to use it. Convince Creature is the only other rune that requires mana to use.
Many creatures are immune to Paralysis, and any creatures that are Self-Healing will cancel the paralysis when they heal themselves.
Paralyze runes are mostly used in war. Since you can heal only once per step, the paralyze rune will slow down your opponent and allow your team to combo the enemy to death.
This rune was once available for all vocations with magic level 18 and higher to use, however a patch changed this. It costs 6000 Soul Points per Backpack.
For the spell, see Paralyse.

name: Poison Bomb Rune
notes:
Notes
 Creates a 3x3 area of Poison Gas.On PvP worlds, this spell is especially useful in player battles, as it achieves the same trapping effect as a fire bomb but does not kill low level characters looking to give players unjustified kills.  The poison fields will last for 4:08.
You can use the Poison Bomb like Destroy field runes, because the fields disappear and clean the fields that were there before.
Before some major updates you used to be able to trap monsters in bombs and they would not walk out (Ex: GS trapped in Firebomb)
For the spell, see Poison Bomb.

name: Poison Field Rune
notes:
Notes
 Creates a poison cloud which deals an initial damage of 5 per hit. Total damage is 105 hitpoints (5 turns of 5 hp, 5 rounds of 4, 7 rounds of 3, 10 rounds of 2 and 19 rounds of 1) untill damage stops (when not healed).This rune may be useful to block certain monsters in PvP worlds. However it is useless against anyone over level 10 as they can easily just use exana pox to heal themselves from the poison damage.
A poison field lasts for 4 minutes and 8 seconds.
For the spell, see Poison Field.

name: Poison Wall Rune
notes:
Notes
 Creates a 1x5 Poison Field area if shot straight from the body. If shot on an angle, a total of 9 poison field squares will be made spanning 5 sqm vertical and 5 sqm horizontal.It should not be bought unless you are wishing to own all Spells as most monsters - especially stronger ones - are immune to earth damage, making it useless in many situations. However, it might be useful to block a monster from attacking by shooting it in a narrow path. The poison fields will last for 4:08.
For the spell, see Poison Wall.

name: Sorc and Druid Attack Rune
notes:
Notes
This rune was implemented in the Winter Update 2012 when Isle of Destiny was revamped, suggesting that it was intended to be given during the Festival of Initiates. Although the item name implies this rune can only be used by sorcerers and druids, there is no actual vocation requirement to use it. It is believed to be an Unobtainable Item. The type of damage is believed to be Energy Damage, but this has not been confirmed yet.

name: Soulfire Rune
notes:
Notes
 Causes the target to catch on fire.This rune causes 10 damage every 9 seconds for a period of time. How long the effect will last depends upon your level and magic level.
This rune is most effective when used as the first attack against a strong creature, causing them to burn while being attacked. It's used mostly in PVP combat to keep the enemy from logging out or fleeing to a Protection Zone. Note that the caster is not able to logout while target burns, too.
Formula for amount of ticks is very simple. 
For Druid and Sorcerer it's a sum of Level and Magic Level and both divided by 3.
AMOUNT_OF_TICKS = (LEVEL + MAGIC) / 3
If you are a Knight you have to sum your Level and Magic Level and divide both by 20. Paladin have to divide the sum by 15.
To throw soulfire for 15 minutes you need to be a Druid or Sorcerer with atleast (Level + Magic Level) above 300. Or Knight with Level above 2000 or Paladin with Level around 1460 and Magic Level around 40.
It's not known there is a cap for how long the effect can lasts. Rumors are the cap is 15 minutes (1000 damage in total). But it needs to be checked.
For the spell, see Soulfire.

name: Stalagmite Rune
notes:
Notes
 Sends out an earth missile (like HMM), it deals Earth Damage.This is the old Envenom rune. It can be very useful for low level mages, since cyclops are weak to earth damage.
For the spell, see Stalagmite.

name: Stone Shower Rune
notes:
Notes
 Shoots an earth attack that covers a large circular area around the target, this is the Druids' equivalent of the Thunderstorm.This is a new rune added in the Winter Update 2007. The player using the Stone Shower rune is never affected by it. This rune can be used as a scam by telling other players to use it as Chameleon Rune, thus making the victim skulled.
For the spell, see Stone Shower.

name: Sudden Death Rune
notes:
Notes
 Shoots a powerful Death Damage attack on a single target.This is arguably the strongest rune in the game. However, as it is a quite expensive rune, it's mostly used to kill strong Monsters fast, or gain a large amount of Experience in a relatively short time span.
For the spell, see Sudden Death.
Reward from the Iron Helmet Quest.

name: Thunderstorm Rune
notes:
Notes
 Shoots an Energy Damage attack that covers a large area around the target, this is the Sorcerers' equivalent of the Stone Shower.New spell in the Winter Update 2007. The player using the Thunderstorm rune is never affected by it.
For the spell, see Thunderstorm.

name: Tiny Healing Rune
notes:
Notes
This rune was implemented in the Winter Update 2012 when Isle of Destiny was revamped, suggesting that it was intended to be given during the Festival of Initiates. It is believed to be an Unobtainable Item.

name: Ultimate Healing Rune (Item)
notes:
Notes
Heals the target a large amount of HP. The amount changes with the magic level and level of the user.
Most frequently, players use this rune on themselves, but it can also be used to rescue a fellow player or a summoned creature from dying.Druids or Sorcerers using this rune on themselves are guaranteed to heal completely because their magic power is a lot higher and their maximum hit points are much lower than knights or paladins of equal level.
Prior to the Christmas Update of 2007, this rune was widely used by knights, however, after the update they are not longer useful for knights or paladins.
This rune can be used by mages to heal themselves or their blocker. Ultimate Healing Rune (Item) is by average around 5% weaker than Heal Friend (at higher levels difference is near 4%). The biggest advantage of this rune is that it has the highest minimal healing, making it the safest healing in critical fights. For example, if you heal your blocker with two very weak heal friend spells in a row which may not be enough to keep blocker alive, this rune have higher minimal healing which may be safer and less luck-based healing. Keep in mind, using this rune shares cooldown with other runes and potions.
For the spell, see Ultimate Healing Rune.

name: Wild Growth Rune
notes:
Notes
 Creates a rune to cast a tree which blocks off 1 square meter.
This spell is similar to a Magic Wall: It creates a tree which lasts for 30 to 60 seconds and blocks one square meter. The main difference is that ammunition, spells and runes may also be shot through Wild Growth. 
On Open PvP, Retro Open PvP, Hardcore PvP and Retro Hardcore PvP words, they can be destroyed using a Heavy Machete or Machete. On Optional PvP worlds they can be destroyed by walking over them. 
The cost to make one of these runes with regular mana potions and selling the vials is around 135 gps, so having the soul points and the time, it is better to make them with mana potions than buy them on NPC. 
For the spell, see Wild Growth.
